title: When should new people start playing PVP? (not bots)
body: What level do you guys think that you  should start playing PVP?

replies.body:
Personally I think it is best to start PVP as soon as a player has basic knowledge of the common beginner champions (the 450 ip ones) and after you've played around with some of the other champs in free week rotations.
 You also start getting[ less IP from bots](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752824-Reward-IP-XP-System-Breakdown#h4) from level 10 onwards, so even if you are losing you will still be getting rewarded nicely for it. 

Sticking with bots too long can lead to bad habits such as terrible CS, terrible map awareness and inability to predict enemy aggression. , You also miss out on exposure to a wide variety of champs (its the same bots over and over again), as well as not really learning much about the "meta" laning (by this I mean, what types of champs go where and do what). 

The best way to play pvp (especially when you are lower level and aren't guaranteed to be matched with and against new players like yourself) is in a group of friends. A bunch of people that will play with you to have fun and learn to improve, and not mind when you aren't doing so well.

ASAP. I started when I was around level 20. Was a little late since ofcourse EVERYONE jumps into ranked once they hit 30 whether they are ready or not.

It will save you a lot of trouble down the road to get good early. Even if you get pummeled, atleast you've learnt something.

I'd say get TIer 2 runes, since they are only 1 IP each and go for it.

Also mute people instantly if they are being negative. dont bother "letting it slide", people are assholes and its better to not listen to them
asap. PvP is how you properly learn to play LoL.

I'd say as soon as you hit lvl18 and get a keystone, and then never tell anyone what level you are. You'll probably do pretty bad since you are new and don't have runes (only buy tier 3 runes) but you'll pick up alot of experience and a keystone is enough to at least give you a chance. Once you do get lvl30 and runes you'll be whooping people though since you'll have reached a point where you didn't need runes to win.
at the start of a ranked season. Not the end.

as soon as you can. I was a bit hesitant but I played with a friend (duo bot) and the first few games I basically followed him around the map / he told me where I should be, when to go aggressive etc

in pvp, your opponents will*: dodge your skillshots, counter attack, bait you into a bad situation, recognise when they are ahead of you and be more aggressive / shut you out of lane, actually have a jungler who ganks you when you are too far forwards (or when they can tower dive you), employ lv1 cheese strategies.

And while this may seem offputting, you only learn how to deal with all this by experiencing it yourself and reflecting on what you did that worked (warding, map awareness, safe positioning) and what didn't (tunnel visioned on a specific enemy, not respecting all-in potential, being too passive).

Apologies in advance for the games where a fed enemy {{champion:55}} face-rolls everyone on your team.

All the best!
*maybe ranked more-so than normals.

The second you reach a high enough level to start playing PVP instead of bots, I say go for it. You learn so much more from playing against other human players as opposed to Riots grand AI bots. Yes there are smurfs, but there are systems in place to match good players/smurfs with other good players/smurf, and the actual new players with other new players.

When you have a friend with you that knows the game well, there are plenty of smurfs around low levels than will know the game better than new players do by a wide margin, i may or may not be guilty of smurfing, But Gold 3 isn't that high hehe, but yea you wanna play PvP when you have a a friend that knows the game well to do it with. In other words, As soon as you get some friends
When you feel like you are ready. I have a mate who only played bots even though he was level 30 and he is so bad at csing, warding, zoning etc. Play when you are ready,
